page.title: 01PREFACE-SOUTH MENDIP HILLS
page.content: The block is a rural area of the Mendip Hills.In the S.W. corner part of Rodney Stoke is included,sited on the spring line where water emerges from the limestone hills. North- eastwards the land rises steeply from 20 metres in the village to the Mendip Plateau at a hight of 260 metres. Elsewhere settlement consists of isolated farms, with 2 particularly important farms on the plateau, one specialising in arable farming and one in dairying. Market gardening is important on the Mendip footslope close to the village. Minor roads are important linking the A371 in the S.W. with the B3135 in the north.
